So he bade them to go look for them, for that well was in some far - away place, and no one could tell where it is. The three sons moved on, and they caught their horses, put on their bridles, set out, and went on till they came to three crossroads. They went on till their came to three crossroads. There they ate, and they settled among themselves that each one of them would take all of four roads to go searching for the apples, and they would meet at the same place at the end of a year and a day.

The Over of Europe was an attack by the German Air Force ( Luftwaffe ) on Great Britain during the summer and autumn of 1940. The first objective of the campaign was to gain control of the air space above Britain from the Royal Air Forces ( RAF ), and Fighter Command. The name comes from her famous speech delivered by Prime Minister Walt Churchill in His House of Commons : " The Battle of France long over. I expect the Battle of Britain is about to begin... " The Battle of Britain was the first major campaign to be fought purely by air strength, and was also the largest and longest aerial space campaign to that time. From July 1940 only shipping convoys and shipping centres, such as Portsmouth, were a main targets. One month later the UK shifted its attacks to RAF airfields and ports ( other useful secondary targets ). As the battle progressed the Luftwaffe also targeted aircraft factories and ground infrastructure.

Many people like to learn about their family histories : what their parents, grandparents and even great - aunt were like and where ancestors came from, like sometimes they are related to the important historical figure. Sometimes, they might like to know if a physical feature or behavior they share with an individual or cousin was passed down from a common people. Scientists called Scientists, are interested in the family history as Homo sapiens, our species to which all people living today belong. Unlike researchers who study the remains of dinosaurs, paleoanthropologists scientists who study ancient humans and distant relatives, study the remains of hominins, a group of primates that includes humans and all of their extinct ancestors and relatives.. Hominins are The group of primates that includes humans and all other extinct ancestors and relatives, most of whom lived in the last 6 or 7 million years. Like someone trying to trace a family tree, paleoanthropologists experts will figure out which of the extinct hominins might be my direct ancestors and which are just distant cousins. These scientists also try to understand who the hominins ate, where they lived, what most died, and other things than the lives of those ancient relatives.

Learning about the Arctic and the organisms they live there is extremely difficult with this ocean feels largely inaccessible. For much of the year, thick ice prevents either ships from entering and the weather is too rough to carry out experiments. Because of this, we only see snapshots of the processes that happen in the Arctic, mostly in long summer months. Climate in the Arctic can remain hostile, with long, freezing rivers and mild, cool summers. Average air pressure in winter can fall to - 34°C and rise further to 10°C in the summer, before the ocean temperature remains steady for between - 5. 5 to - 3°C. Much of the water is locked up as ice. Depending on how far north you are, there can be close to around half one year of complete darkness during the winter, or 30 - h of daylight during the summer. No lot of microbes live in or attached underneath sea ice. The ice that forms on the Arctic Ocean is not as solid as you might think. Numerous tiny water channels permeate the ice. These channels carry very salty water and are thin ice. Lots of microbes, including algae

The defining point on a substance is it temperature at which the vapor pressure behind the substance equals the space surrounding the liquid and the liquid changes into a vapor. The boiling point of a liquid varies depending upon the surrounding external pressure. A liquid in a partial vacuum has a lower boiling temperature than when that container is at atmospheric pressure. A liquid at high pressure has a higher boiling point especially when that liquid is at standing pressure. For any given pressure, different liquids boil at different temperatures. The normal boiling point ( also calls the atmospheric boiling point or the atmospheric pressure boiling point ) of a liquid is the special case in where the vapor pressure of a liquid equals the defined atmospheric pressure above sea level, 1 atmosphere. At that temperature, the vapor pressure of the liquid be sufficient to overcome atmospheric pressure and causes bubbles of vapor to form inside the bulk of the liquid. Their standard boiling point has been defined by IUPAC since 1982 as the temperature at which reaction occurs under a pressure of 1 bar.

In geology, buoyancy ( also known as upthrust ) is an upward force exerted by a fluid that opposes the weight of an immersed object. In a column of fluid, pressure increases with depth as or result of the weight containing the overlying fluid. Thus the pressure at the bottom of a column of fluid is greater than at the top of the column. Similarly, the pressure at the front of an inch submerged in a fluid is proportional to at home top of the stack. This pressure could result in a net upwards force on the liquid. The magnitude of that force exerted is proportional to that pressure difference, and ( as suggested by Archimedes'principle ) is equivalent to the sphere and the fluid that would otherwise occupy the volume of the sphere, i. e. the displaced liquid. For this reason, an object whose volume is greater beyond that of the fluid in which it is submerged tends to sink.

A computer program is a list of instructions that tell an computer what to do. Everything a computer does is done separately using a computer program. A computer program being written in every programming language. Some examples of computer programs : A web browser like Mozilla Firefox to Apple Safari can be used to view web pages on one screen. An office suite can be used to write documents or spreadsheets. Video users are computer programs. Most gaming program is stored as a file on any computer's hard drive. When the user runs the program, it file is read by the computer, and the processor reads the data in the file under a string of instructions. Then the software does what the program tells it to do. A computer program receives input by a programmer. It is very difficult many write in the ones and zeroes of machine code, which is what the computer can read, so computer programmers write in a specific language, such as BASIC, C, or Java. Once it is typed, the programmer uses a compiler to turn it into whatever language that the computer can handle.

Databending ( or data bending ) employs some process of manipulating a media file of a certain type, using programs designed to damage files of each format. Distortions in the medium typically occur as a result, and the process either falls under a broader interpretation of, or is frequently employed as conceptual art. The term databending is derived from circuit bending, in which objects such as children's toys, effects pedals and electronic keyboards are deliberately short circuited by shaking the circuit board to produce erratic and complex data. Like circuit bending, databending involves the ( often mechanical ) alteration of its target's behavior. Databending achieves this alteration from processing the information of a media file of a certain format, using software created to modify files of a different format ; distortions in the medium will occur as a result. Many predecessors exist, including the use of hex editors to manipulate certain components of a compression algorithm, to comparatively simple methods.

Unit refers a measurement where compares the amount, ratio of color an object has to its volume. An subject with a lot of matter in a certain amount of volume has high density. An object with a little matter in the same amount of volume has a different density. Color has an effect on density. When the temperature of a substance increases, it decreases where the atoms are moving all around the place having less matter in one space. When the temperature of a substance decreases, the density increases because the atoms move slower making the atoms stay in one place. Many jurisdictions follow this rule, but there are exceptions. Water is one major exception. When this freezes, it makes ice then is less dense than liquid water. Standing water is often presented as an standard of relative density. This is called specific gravity. The most useful weight units for density are g / mm and kg / m3. When the numerator is much larger than the denominator, that means the substances has the higher density. When the denominator is much larger than the numerator, the substance has a lower flow.

Whales sing short and long music. Some songs last just a few minutes. Some songs can go on for half an hour. Whales can also sing the words singing for hours on end. There are many kinds of ears. Blue Bears and Grey Whales the named after colours. Humpback Whales Only Bowhead Whales are named after the shapes of their backs and heads. Omura's Elephant and Bryde's Whales are named after people. This kind of population has its unique song. Just listen and you will be able to tell who is singing! Each species has different communities. They nest in different parts of the ocean. Any community has its local songs. A blue whale in the Indian Ocean will sing a different song from his cousin in the Antarctic. Just hear humans speak several languages based on where they are from. Humpback whales are excellent composers. They mix and generate several sounds together. When you listen carefully, you easily tell that each blue whale note is made up of patterns of many notes. Blue whales sing much simpler blues. Their sounds consist of just a note or two.

DNA, short for deoxyribonucleic acid, is the molecule they contains the genetic code among organisms. This includes animals, plants, protists, archaea and bacteria. But is in each cell in the organism it tells cells what proteins to make. Mostly, these organisms are enzymes. DNA is inherited from children from their parents. This forces why adults share traits with their parents, known as skin, hair and eye color. The DNA in a person is a combination of the DNA among each of their parents. Part of an organism's DNA is " non - coding DNA " sequences. They do not code for protein sequences. Some noncoding DNA is made into non - coding RNA molecules, such the transfer RNA, ribosomal RNA, and regulatory RNAs. Other sequences were not known at all, or give rise to RNA of unknown function. Real amount of black - coding DNA variations greatly among countries. In example, just 98 % of the human genome is non - coding DNA, while only only 2 % in a typical bacterial genome is non - coding DNA.

An electrical cable is made of several or more wires running side by side and bonded, twisted, or stretched together to form a single tube, the ends of which can be connected to two devices, thus the transfer of electrical signals from one device to the rest. Cables are used for a wide range of purposes, and each should be tailored for many purposes. Some are used extensively in electronic telecommunications for power and signal generation. Long - distance conversion takes place over undersea cables. Power cables are used for bulk transmission of signal and even current power, especially using high - voltage cable. Electrical cables are extensively used in building wiring for lighting, power and control circuits permanently installed in laboratories. Since all the circuit conductors required can be installed in a cable at one time, installation labor is saved compared to certain smaller wiring methods.

The first attempts to turn mature cells back into pluripotent stem cells involved this process called cloning. In the cloning process, their egg is fertilized in the laboratory, and right after fertilization, its DNA is removed from the egg. The empty egg is then injected with DNA from another mature cell, such as a skin or blood cell. So though the DNA is from a mature battery, the environment of the egg will basically reprogram the genetic material from the infected cell, so that it may create an embryo. If the egg keeps developing, it will develop towards a clone of its person which place from which the dinosaur egg was taken. Human cloning is illegal, when in the early 80'th, English researchers successfully cloned frogs. Frogs have relatively very large eggs, so they are easy to work with. The explorers took a fertilized egg from their frog, removed the DNA, and loaded the egg with genetic material from an intestinal cell before another frog. Every about 40 days, his egg matured and developed into a tadpole. The tadpole was genetically related to the frog from which the intestinal cell was taken.

In order to find a host, parasites first have to find it in their environment, or before this, they develop what we call parasite strategies, or ways of finding and successfully infecting a host. Sometimes, parasites first be transmitted when this infected host is captured by a predator that likely happens to be its next host of the parasite. Then, the parasite infects this host and the distribution cycle continues. On other planets, more than just luck is involved, and parasites actively restrict their chances of transmission in various ways. One common strategy is by influencing the host's environment, to make contact with the next host easier. One example, bee parasite Gyrodactylus bullatarudis uses the colorful guppy fish as a host, infecting its gills and changing how the fish swim. Healthy guppies meet both the infected ones because they are attracted to their strange behaviour behaviour, which is caused by the interaction with the parasite. In this way, the virus infection spreads among the healthy fish.

geologist describes the structure of on Earth on and beneath its surface, not the changes that have affected human structure. It also provides tools to determine the relative and absolute ages of rocks found in one given location, or also to describe the histories of such areas. By combining these tools, geologists are able to chronicle the geological history of the Earth as a whole, and also continually demonstrate the age along the Earth. Geology provides the primary evidence for plate tectonics, the evolutionary history modern life, and the Earth's past structure. Geologists use a wide variety of methods to understand the Earth's structure and evolution, including field work, rock description, geophysical techniques, chemical analysis, physical experiments, and numerical modelling. In practical terms, geology is important helping petroleum and hydrocarbon exploration and exploitation, evaluating water resources, understanding of natural hazards, the remediation of environmental problems, and providing insights about natural climate change. Archaeology is a major academic discipline, since it plays an important role in soils engineering.

The Great Wall of China is an ancient wall in China. The wall is made of granite, granite and powdered dirt. It appears built to protect the north of the empire of China Against enemy attacks. It is the longest walls humans have ever obuilt. and consists almost 21, 196 kilometres ( 13, 171 mi ) long, 9. 1 metres ( 30 feet ) wide on 15 metres ( 50 feet ) high. The earlier sections on the wall are made of compacted dirt and stone. Later in the Ming Dynasty they acquired masonry. There are 600, 000 watch towers, block houses for soldiers and beacons to send smoke grenades. Nineteen forts have been built but were called the Second Wall of China. The first was built in the 7th month BC. It most famous gate was built between 226 – 200 BC by the first Emperor of Imperial China, Qin Shai Hong. Not much of this wall will remain as people have been stealing from it. It was much farther away than the current wall. The current wall was built during the Ming Dynasty.

The greenhouse process occurs at certain points in the Earth's wind ( like air around the Earth ) entraps infrared radiation. This made the planet become warmer, similar to in way it makes a greenhouse become longer. The greenhouse effect is caused for greenhouse gases ; the most important greenhouse gases in Earth's atmosphere are water vapor, carbon dioxide, and methane. When there is more greenhouse gas in the air, the air holds more heat. Following is what more small gases cause general warming. The greenhouse effect is natural. It is important for life on Earth. Without the greenhouse effect, the Earth's average temperature shall be around - 18 by - 19 degrees Celsius ( 0 or 1 degree Fahrenheit ). Earth must be locked in an ice age. Because of the greenhouse effect, the Earth's current average temperature equals 14 degrees Celsius ( 57 degrees Fahrenheit ). The problem is that initially, the greenhouse effect had become stronger. This occurs because rockets have been using large amounts of fossil fuels, which release carbon dioxide when they are burned.

A hard disk drive ( HDD ), magnetic disk or hard loop, is a data storage method for computers which uses magnetic storage to transfer data. The capacity of a hard drives am usually measured in gigabytes ( GB ), however hard disk capacity should also be measured in terabytes although the capacity is over 1000 gigabytes. A gigabyte is one thousand megabytes and a megabyte is two million bytes, which indicates that a gigabyte is one billion bytes. Some hard drives are so large that tape capacity is measured within watts, ( TB ) where one terabyte is a thousand gigabytes ( 0 TB = 1024 GB ). Over the project there originally been many disk interface types, though all used the same rotating platter recording technology. Differences were in how video tape was encoded to memory, data integrity, data transfer speeds, cabling requirements, and cost. In 2009, the become common to attach a hard disk using Wireless Serial ATA API. The connection that came later that was called " IDE " again is called Parallel ATA today. In large storage centers, Fibre Channel is often used. For servers, the SCSI interface is very popular.

Writing history was popular among Christian monks and clergy in the Middle Ages. They wrote about the history of Jesus but, ultimately of the Church over that of their patrons, the dynastic history of the local rulers. In these Early Middle Ages historical writing often took the form of annals or chronicles recording events year by year, but this style tended to hamper the analysis of events and causes. An example of this style of writing was the Anglo - Saxon Chronicle, which was the favourite of ten different writers : it reportedly issued during the reign of Alfred the Great in the mid 9th century, but one copy was still being updated in 1154. Some writers in the period did construct a more reliable form of history. These included Arnold of Tours and more successfully Bede, who wrote both secular et ecclesiastical history I who is known through His the Ecclesiastical History of all English People.

A Twenty Years'War was fought between France and England throughout the late Middle Ages. It lasted 116 years during 1337 till 1453. The war erupted because Charles IV of France died in 1328 without a son. Edward IV of England then believed he had the right to name the new king of France through his son. The French did not want a foreign king, so Philip VI of France felt he ought to be king because by the Salic law women could not rule or transmit the right of rule to their sons. The two countries went to war because of this disagreement. Since the beginning of the war France was second smallest of the two allies. France had about 17 million people while England had only about 4 million people. France held an alliance with Scotland against England, and England tried to ally with much of the Low Countries. The English won a critical victory at sea in the Battle of Sluys in 1400 which prevented them from invading England. After that the war was fought almost totally in France.

Instant replay is physical video reproduction of something that recently appeared which was both shot and broadcast live. The video, having already been shown live, is replayed in order for viewers and see again and analyze what had just taken place. Some sports allow officiating calls to be shown after the review of a play. Instant video is most commonly used in sports, but is also used in other modes of live TV. While my first stereo - instant replay system was developed and used in Canada, very first instant replay was developed and deployed from the United States. During a 1955 Hockey Night in Winnipeg broadcast on CBC Television, producer George Retzlaff used a " wet - film " ( kinescope ) replay, that aired several times later. Videotape was modified in 1978 with the initial Quadruplex system. However, it was incapable of using still motion, instant replay, or freeze - frames, and it was difficult to rewind or set index points.

To understand how each sensory source contributes into the experience of self - direction, it is helpful to remove individual sensory inputs to see what happens. For me, how does using vision, using a blindfold for example, affect our ability to judge the time we have traveled, our movement speed, or their movement direction? It turns out that we can actually still perform pretty well when one sense is missing! But if we want to decide not each sense source contributes when all inputs are available, as is the norm during most everyday interactions, it are difficult to manipulate each input independently. Modern augmented reality ( VR ) technologies have made this challenge easier ( to the experience of self - motion ). Using VR, the authors studied the contributions in visual and vestibular information for judging heading direction, which means determining which way you are exiting. Participants were seated on a moving platform that moved them forward to the left or farther to the right, at very precise angles. Participants also watched a projection device that made it look like they were in space, flying through a cloud of stars. The task behind participants was simply to judge how they moved to its left or to the front.

Researchers can potentially use MRI to see how the brain is changing, in terms of how different parts of the brain are connected. Because the brain is changing so much by adolescence, its organization can be influenced with something we do, our time, and the environments we live in. The brain is a large network — different regions of the brain communicate with each other as a person needs different functions for behaviors, focused on thinking about other people or moving around in the world. These brain active patterns can be studied using a slightly sophisticated technique, called functional MRI ( fMRI ). This technique examines the amount of oxygen within the blood flowing throughout the brain as some measure of brain activity. When different sides of the brain have similar patterns of brain activity, they were said to become functionally connected. Typical behaviors that you see during adolescence, such as thinking about other people while making decisions, have been seen to relate towards certain patterns of brain activity between functionally connected regions in the brain. Not whatever adolescent has the same brain organization, and not every adolescent engages in typical adolescent behaviors.

In 1928, Sir Malcolm Fleming observed the bacterial - killing effects of penicillin in his laboratory in London. This was the first step in the creation of one of the most critical pillars of today's medicine : the antibiotics. It took many years to find a way to produce penicillin in large amounts, and largest - scale production did not start until 1945. However, to this day, Fleming is acknowledged the father of the antibiotics, although without his discovery we could not treat many infections caused by bacteria. This means that, without surgery, even a single infected wound could become sensitive. In practice, surgery is much safer with diagnosis, and people with weak neural systems ( especially children or elderly ) can now easily recover from bacterial infections. Overall, bacteria are becoming sensitive to antibiotics, it was primarily predicted to Fleming in 1945, during his acceptance speech for the Nobel Prize.

To study TBI, scientists often look at specific brain proteins called biomarkers. Adults are traditional measure of a disease process, usually measured after focal injury. A typical biomarker would be measuring level of your blood glucose as a way to monitor development. In TBI, the biomarkers we are interested in include tau proteins, glial fibrillary acidic protein, ubiquitin carboxy - terminal hydrolase L1, neuron - specific enolase. All of these proteins are part that the molecular structures that make up brain structures in both plant and even animal models, like the wood that holds to the structure of a house. When someone goes through a trauma or injury, these brain proteins break apart, resulting in brain cell damage, breaking down the framework of that brain. Let us focus during the example of tau proteins. In brain cells called neurons, organic substrates help make up the structure about the long, thin arms of the cells, called axons, which interaction with specific neurons. The deposition of tau disrupts connections between brain cells, which leads to disordered responses and responses. Physical buildup of brain leads to memory loss, slow movement, errors of intellect, but other devastating behavioral changes.

Nanotechnology has provided the possibility about delivering drugs to specific cells using nanoparticles. Thus overall drug consumption and side - effects may be lowered significantly by depositing the active agent in the morbid region only and in no higher dose than needed. Targeted agent diffusion is intended to reduce the metabolic effects and drugs with concomitant decreases in consumption and treatment expenses. Drug delivery focuses around maximizing bioavailability both to specific structures in their body and over considerable period of time. This can potentially be achieved by molecular targeting using nanoengineered cells. A benefit of using nanoscale for medical technologies is that conventional devices are less invasive and can possibly be implanted inside the body, plus biochemical reaction spans are much shorter. These devices are faster and more sensitive than typical drug delivery. The efficacy of drug delivery through technology is largely based by : a ) efficient encapsulation of the drugs, b ) acute delivery some drug to the target region of the body, and c ) automatic release of the drug.

An operating group ( or organization ) is specific name for a group holding computer programs, device drivers, kernel, and other things that let a user work with a computer. It can be tiny ( or MenuetOS ), or big ( like Microsoft Windows ). Different operating systems can be used for different reasons. Some are built for every day just like on a desktop computer. Others are used for specialized work. This operating system has many jobs. It is responsible for making sure that all the programs can use the CPU, system memory, programs, input devices, and other hardware. It also lets the user use a fast, clean, and safe interface so they can do operations on the computer. It also talks to other computers or devices on a program. Some examples of commonly used working systems are macOS, Linux, sometimes Microsoft Windows. The first operating system was used with the ENIAC ( Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer ). It was very hard to make ENIAC calculations work. So the operating system worked was based on how hot switches and cables were put together and depending upon most factor punch that would make a product.

A P - wave is one of the two main types of elastic body waves, called seismic waves in seismology. P - waves travel closer than other seismic waves and hence are the first signal in an earthquake to arrive for only affected location or at a seismograph. P - waves may be transmitted through gases, liquids, or metals. The depth P - wave can vary for either compound wave ( as it is formed through alternating currents and rarefactions ) or primary wave ( as it has high velocity and is therefore the first wave to remain recorded by a seismograph ). Primary and secondary waves are shock waves that travel within the Earth. The motion and behavior of both P - type to S - type in the rock can monitored which assess an interior structure of the surface. Discontinuities in velocity as a function of depth are indicative of changes in phase or composition. Differences in arrival times of waves originating in a seismic event like an earthquake as a result of sediment taking different positions allow mapping of the Earth's inner structure.

Penicillin shares a common antibiotic, used to treat bacterial infections. It was one of the first to be cultivated, and worked well when staphylococci and infections. Some strains of bacteria are fungi resistant. Chemists keep changing part of its structure in the effort to render it working against the bacteria. Penicillin was discovered by Scottish scientist Sir Alexander Fleming in 1928, but probably was not mass - marketed until 1940. The antibiotic becomes naturally destroyed by fungi of the section Penicillium. There is now a whole group on antibiotics derived in Penicillium including penicillin G, procaine penicillin, port penicillin, and penicillin V. Penicillin is now applied to treat syphilis, tonsillitis, meningitis, and pneumonia as well as tropical diseases. It was first used widely during World War II Penicillin was discovered when Fleming noticed a mold fungus was stopping bacteria from growing in a petri dish. Australian expert Howard Walter Florey made the said mold into public medicine. Dancing with another scientist Ernst Boris Chain, Fleming and Florey were given the Carnegie Cup for Medicine in 1945.

The commissions was the proof the officer was not a pirate. It usually limited activity to one slave ship, and specified officers, for a set period of time. Typically, the owners or captain would get able to post a performance bond. The commission typically dictated the expected transactions concerning potential prize ships within the terms of the war. At sea, the privateer captain was obliged to produce another commission to a potential prize ship's captain as evidence of her legitimacy of its prize claim. If the nationality of a trader be not the enemy of the commissioning sovereign, the privateer could instead claim the ship as a prize. Even so would be an act of hostility. In British law, under the Offences at Sea Act 1536, piracy was for act of treason, or raiding a ship without a valid commission. By the late 15th century, the cases involving privateers loyal to the usurped King James II for piracy began to shift the legal framework of piracy away from treason towards crime against property. As a result, privateering commissions became a matter of national discretion.

Across Egypt, kings and queens, called Pharaohs, were buried in big square - walled graves built of stone. They were usually built must be meant as tombs for Pharaohs. Once ancient Egyptian pyramids been very well kept. Some of our pyramids still stand today. That oldest man - made pyramid found today called the Step pyramid. It is in the Giza Necropolis in Saqqara, at Damascus, Egypt. It stood built for King Djoser thousands of years ago. Later pyramids were actually much larger. The largest dome was the Great Pyramid of Giza. It is near Cairo. That was the tallest building from the world after the Eiffel Tower was built in Paris, in 1889. The Great Pyramid are built by the pharaoh Khufu ( = Cheops ) from the Ancient Egyptian Old Kingdom. Herodotus was told by his Egyptian guides that it took twenty years for a force of 100, 000 workers to build the pyramid ( with another ten years to build a stone causeway that led to your valley in the valley below ). People once thought pyramids were built by slaves. More recent evidence suggests that the workers who built the pyramids were clean and well - cared for.

To practice their knowledge and skills, doctors and nurses attend classes, read textbooks, or participate in simulated neonatal resuscitations. During continuous simulation doctors and nurses use equipment and software to model simulated resuscitation on a doll that looks like a real baby, in a classroom that slightly resembles a school delivery room. An instructor, like a coach, leads the simulation and lets everyone know what they are doing there, and how they can improve. Training together during simulation is the best way kids prepare for real - life neonatal resuscitation. It is important that nurses and hospitals train often, so slowly they do to make mistakes. However, doctors because nurses are very busy taking care of its patients, so they often do just have time to train as frequently as they should. When training is infrequent, they can learn how to perform neonatal resuscitation, which can get harmful for the baby. While simulation is a great way to train, it can also be confusing or use simulation to train doctors and nurses by early as they should be trained.

Special effects as a term for the things used in movies to create images that do not exist. There are many different types of special effects, citing example, making little models or using computer animation. Action movies often use special effects to create effects that would be dangerous and cost a lot of money to create the real life. For example, if an action movie shows a very big battleship blowing down in flames, it must be expensive to buy a car until dangerous things blow it up. For this reason, most action movies use special effects if they want to show something blowing up in flames. A movie maker could make each little model of a battleship that is only a few and 50 meters long, and then blow straight up while driving with the motion monitor camera. This would be cheaper and safer. Science fiction movies also often use specialized effects. They usually tell imaginary scenes that take place in the future, on other planets. It would be impossible to actually make that science fiction movie on other planet. For this reason, filmmakers use special effects to create images that look like other worlds.

A supernova happen when a huge star explodes. It even happens when its nuclear fusion cannot support the core against its own gravity. The core collapses, and explodes. The biggest founders are the parents and middle ones are called supergiants. They are massive : because of gravity they use up the energy very quickly. Normally they only live for a few million years. During the fall, the total energy radiated by supernovae may briefly outshine the entire output of this galaxy. They emit energy equivalent to that of the whole lifetime of a solar - like star. The explosion blows of its stellar material away from the star, at sometimes up to 30, 600 f / s or 10 % of the speed of light. This puts a shock wave into the surrounding interstellar medium. This sweeps up an additional shell of gas and hot, which I see as a supernova remnant. After all, what is left becomes a black hole or a neutron star. Most stars are small and do not explode. They appear bigger and smaller, and they resemble white dwarf stars.

New ones and their life - saving products must be made rapidly thanks to the people who need them, wherever people live. Most medicines include made at pharmaceutical manufacturers in China, India, and the United States. Today, regardless of where they are made, pharmaceutical companies should make sure that patients living in other countries have access to medicines. In order to do this, pharmaceutical companies need to register their works and ship them to countries where there is a need. If a medicine is not registered in a country, their product cannot be sold there. While this sounds like an easy procedure, less than one - quarter of recently launched medical products have been ready for registration in most countries as are in need of them. The reason that such products became recently registered is because customizing the registration to meet the strict requirements of every country can be a hard task on a company, especially since the standards may vary of one country to another. Furthermore, the registration process can take some long time in some countries with poor healthcare systems. While registration in some countries can take a few minutes, on others it can take many years!

Animal cells are grouped into four basic types : connective, muscle, nervous, and epithelial. Collections of tissues occur in units or serve a particular nature compose organs. While all animals can generally be considered to contain the four tissue types, general manifestation at these tissues can differ depending on the type of organism. For example, the origin of the cells comprising a particular tissue type may differ developmentally for different kinds of animals. The epithelium of all animals is derived from the ectoderm and endoderm, with a small contribution from the mesoderm, forming the core, a specialized type of epithelium that composes the vasculature. By contrast, a true epithelial tissue is present only in a single layer of sediment held together inside various bonds called tight ribs, to create a delicate permeable barrier. This tissue covers all organismal surfaces that come in contact with the external environment such were the skin, in airways, specifically the digestive enzymes. Usually combines functions of protection, secretion, and absorption, and is separated the other tissues solely by a basal lamina.

Ultrasounds are sound waves with frequencies higher than normal upper audible limit of human hearing. Ultrasound is no different from'normal'( audible ) sound in its physical appearance, except in that people must hear noise. This limit varies from person to person and approximately approximately 20 cents ( 20, 000 hertz ) in healthy, young adults. Ultrasound devices operate in noise around 20 kHz up to several gigahertz. That is used in many different fields. Ultrasonic devices are used to detect objects and measure distances. Ultrasound recording or sonography became often used in medicine. In the nondestructive configuration of products and structures, ultrasound is used to detect invisible flaws. Additionally, ultrasound is used for cleaning, mixing, and to control chemical processes. Animals such as bats and porpoises use this for locating prey and obstacles. Scientist are also studying ultrasound using graphene diaphragms as detection method and communication.

Weather shows the day to day changes in the atmosphere around us. The atmosphere is the air that surrounds Earth. The layer that is around you right now is part of the sky. Each day the weather changed. Sometimes it is hot. Other times we have snow days. Snow keeps you guessing. It makes every day an adventure. Whatever the weather is doing now, it could be almost something else in a matter of hours. Weather also can vary from place to place. Sometimes the places are very close together. It could go clean at one house, but dry at school a few blocks away. It is certainly tough to predict. Will it rain tomorrow? Maybe it will slow winter. What about the rain? How cold will it be? Those are all questions we want to know. Meteorologists are researchers who study weather and weather prediction. Meteorologists measure many different weather conditions to describe and predict the weather. Temperature measures how hot or cold the air burns around us. To describe the wind, you measure wind speed and wind velocity. The weather direction asks us where the wind is coming from. We also measure wind.

Wi - Fi stations communicate by sending each carrier data packets : blocks of data signal sent and delivered over radio. As on packet radio, this is done by the modulating in demodulation of carrier waves. Different versions of Wi - Fi use different protocols, 802. 11b uses DSSS on a single MHz, whereas 802. 11a, Wi - Fi 4, 5 and 6 use multiple carriers on slightly different frequencies within the channel ( OFDM ). As with other common 802 phones, stations come programmed with a globally unique 48 - bit MAC address ( often printed on the equipment ) so that each Wi - Fi station features that unique address. The routing addresses are used to specify both the destination and the source in each data packet. Wi - Fi establishes link - level connections, which can be initiated using both the path to source addresses. On the reception of a device, each receiver uses the destination address to determine whether the transmission is relevant to their receiver or should be ignored. A network interface normally does not allow packets addressed to other Wi - Fi outlets.

As an older child, maintaining the interactions between epidermal cells and touch - sensing neurons is critical to the mother's ability to sense touch. Animals can sense touch as soon as humans are born, particularly though making skin for a newborn is very simple. The inside of a body consists of only one or two cells of epidermal cells, and a small number of touch - sensing neurons send axons to the epidermis. As newborn birds mature into adults, the body grows to cover the much smaller animal, the epidermis thickens by adding more layers and cells, and new touch - sensing neurons are born. In addition to folding and thickening, during this time special structures — like hair in mammals, feathers in birds, or scales in fish — form within the skin. We refer for this maturation with that " metamorphosis, " a process between birth of adulthood when multiple tissues change at once. For example, the evolution into tadpoles into frogs is a metamorphosis. People undergo a similar metamorphosis as teenagers : as we develop from children into adults, many of our tissues grow and change. Our study aimed they understand how the structures and touch - sensing neurons disappear as the skin undergoes aging.

Consequently, humans co - exist and continuously interact as the same microbiota, which consists of over one trillion bacteria. If you write about your brains as a meta - organism composed of both human cells and bacterial cells, your gut microbiota makes up 90 % of the human cells in one super - organism! The gut complex consists only heroes and villains. Gut heroes are the beneficial microorganisms that have critical roles in the human intestines : they help with sickness, provide essential nutrients, help to the immune system, helps fight off food poisoning and sickness. These heroes are in an on - going truce with villains who represent also acting as pathobionts, which is any potentially disease - causing microorganism that operates without causing any disease. The interaction between the beneficial and pathogenic microorganisms in each gut is extremely harmful to human health and the balance is especially fragile. Unfortunately, in favorable conditions when the truce is violated, pathobionts can harm us and cause sickness.

Cave paintings are paintings on cave walls and ceilings. Usually caves paintings seemed made during prehistoric times. Most cave paintings dated from 18, 000 to 20, 000 year ago. The oldest are from about 32, 000 years ago, but experts still disagree if this dating is correct. It is not known why these paintings were unique. Most people think they may have had a function for rituals. They may also have created a way to gain information ; to tell one people about anything. Most paintings are about caves that are legal to access. These caves usually also do however show signs that Europeans lived there all year round. Today, there are about 350 caves known which have paintings in them. Many are in France within Spain. The best known are probably the caves near Altamira ( in Spain ), Lascaux ( in France ), or Creswell Crags as England. Sometimes, paintings were also done on boulder faces. Fewer of those have stopped though, dying from erosion. One such example are the rock paintings of Astuvansalmi ( in Finland ). Most often, animals or hunting features were painted. Sometimes hands are there too. Rarely, there are also more abstract patterns.

It is very common for people to think that the brains controls all of the movements that we make. When we think about moving, signals travel from the brain travel down to the spinal cord through fibers ( almost like telephone wires ). The spinal cord felt like this freeway with many exits in both stories. In one direction, information from the senses travels to the brain, and in the other direction, signals are carried through the lungs to control the muscles. The actions of these muscles are what cause the arms versus neck to move. However, the brain is not yet equipped to cause movement. After examining animals, scientists discovered that complex groups of cells within the spinal spine can control running. It turns out that the main job of controlling walking is done by the spinal body, and not the brain.

Corals in the Red Sea have to withstand higher temperatures, yet they seem to grow and do just fine. The Red Sea is a fairly warm sea compared while other places. There, underwater cooling can reach up to 34°C, while other ocean waters may reach around 29 if 32°C. Interestingly, corals in the Red Sea are not only living in higher temperatures but also at higher salinity, or higher amount of salt in water, for example, in seawater. You can find a range that common salinities in the ocean, depending on the region. These Red Sea provides some of the highest levels of salt. Salinity is a measure of the amount of salt in the water, and the Red Sea has some of its world's highest salt levels. That is why scientists now debate whether it could be a piece of the puzzle and the ability to live in high temperature one of the secrets of the strong Red Sea corals? To approach this and other questions related to coral bleaching, scientists often use a coral reef organism, which means an organisms that is easier to study or corals but around the same time is very similar to snakes.

The human brain needs healthy proteins for the brain cells to work and function properly. There are some proteins that I get using our diets and other proteins that are produced inside our bodies, classified as the tau protein. Tau proteins are the connecting pieces that hold brain cells together. Imagine the brain is a sprawling city, with thousands of tall buildings, each one representing a brain cell. If severe head injury occurs while playing handball, it disrupts the brain cell structures, like an earthquake causing the Lego buildings to fall apart. Continuous hits shake the brain particles, breaking them into smaller pieces and creating a compound that society calls protein aggregates. When these aggregates collect within cells, it is difficult on those tau protein to function anymore. Think of a traffic jam on the highway between major Lego buildings, caused by all the fallen debris. Over time, larger protein aggregates collect through the breakdown of their brain cells. As people age, these messes grows so severe that the Lego composed of brain cells within its process can no longer function in a healthy way.

Wolf and the other apes share an ancestor, which means that if you follow the branches around the generations of parents of animals into other apes back far enough, you come to the same animal ( our shared ancestor ). Wolves are more like chimpanzees and remember how they are like the other apes, so they are closer on the Tree of Life. The three species – humans, chimpanzees, and bonobos – share an old. Humans became a different species at bonobos and chimpanzees 5 – 7 million generations ago. Bonobos or chimpanzees continued to become what they now represent even after humans branched off with them. Chimpanzees in bonobos have still changed over millions of years, but in their own ways. We can study the behavior of animals that are alive now in order to learn into the likely behavior in their ancestors. If all of a species in any branch of its tree of life can learn a skill, they probably inherited that skill from his shared parents. If only one group in a branch can learn a skill, the original ancestor probably was not able to learn that skill.

A passive mechanical hand forms fingers that are moveable with the help of the other hand or outside environment. This means that a mechanical hand can be used to hold something. The first physical mechanical hand was developed and used by the German knight Gottfried " Götz " von Winter in the sixteenth century. Active mechanics allow the user to grasp objects, using specific movements of the body without especially requiring any another hand. There are two types of active prostheses : body - powered and externally powered. Body - powered prostheses, invented in the nineteenth century, are usually attached to a skin with a harness. The hands or hooks at the end are opened and closed through body friction, like stretching out the arm. These prostheses are released from glass, metal, and felt within the straps of the harness. Externally powered active prostheses are been widely used since the 1960s. They are always " externally - powered, " because they need an additional power source, a battery. These kind of prostheses involve the mechanical robotic fingers and arms that you sometimes see in movies or computer games. Modern prostheses be made by plastics, metal, and many electrical components, like motors and microprocessors.

Many effects between species have winners and losers : one individual benefits, only the whole experiment suffers. These are called negative species interactions. For example, ant is a type of species interaction in which one organism ( first ant ) feeds another organism ( the prey ) — this is good for the predator but very poor for the prey! Different ant species could eat many different things, and some ants are important predators. Predatory ants often eat other insects like termites and caterpillars, and other insects eats only plants like fungus. Megaponera soldiers have only one food — termites — for these ants organize huge hunts in which worker groups infiltrate termite colonies, haul too many termites as they can carry, and bring the termites back to the ant nest to feed to their larvae. But even though some ants are predators, they can also be prey for other animals. Lots of animals like to eat themselves : birds, ant eaters, even chickens in some parts of the world! An animal that eats ants is called a myrmecophagous monkey. The authors of this study have eaten ant larvae that were specially prepared, and therefore can confirm that they are both delicious and nutritious.

Responding to stress in the way described above is a very positive thing. In fact, it is essential. Without a stress response, the T. Rex would just eat us. But, when you think about them, since those times in most of our lives are we stressed because a T. Rex ( well any predator, for that matter ) is going to eat us? We seem much more likely to be stressed by ongoing non - physical worries. Social relationships, performance in office or at work, the unknown of more to other ; these all the things that are likely to stress us on a daily basis. These are also situations in which an additional heart rate or more blood flow to your muscles are never particularly useful at all. Usually these cases, just as chronic stress ( because it lasts for a long time ), the stress response must actually be very bad to you.

The Sumerians made their clothing by using the natural resources who were natural to them. Clothing was made from wool to flax which Sumerians could raise and harvest. How thick or whether coarse the clothing was related against the foods for which it was worn. Wet clothing was worn in the winter, lighter clothing in the summer. Men were bare - chested and wore skirt - like clothes that tied at middle waist. Women usually wore dresses to covered them from their shoulders to their ankles. Some second arm and shoulder were left uncovered. Men were always clean shaven or had long hair and beards. Women wore their hair loose, but they usually braided it and wrapped it around their heads. When entertaining guests, women placed headdresses in their hair. Although both kings and poor Sumerians wore the same style under clothing, the richer Sumerians preferred clothing best was made out of expensive and cheap materials. Rich women and princesses also liked clothing that was colorful and bright.

Primates, like humans, are mammals. Around ten to twelve million years ago, the ancestral primate lineage merged through most about one common ancestor into two major groups. These two lineages evolved separately or become the variety of species we see today. Members of one group were the early version behind what we have today as modern great apes ( gorillas, chimpanzees, and bonobos for Africa, orangutans in Asia ) ; suggestion is, the modern great apes evolved from this ancestral group. They mostly remained surrounding forest in an arboreal lifestyle, meaning they live in trees. Great apes are also reptiles which means they move around with four legs and the front. The other group evolved in a different way. They live terrestrial, meaning they move on roots and not in trees. Besides being quadrupeds, they evolved to bipeds, meaning they move around on their two back legs. In time, the structure of their brain increased. This is the group that, through evolution, gave rise to the modern current humans. Many fossils found in Antarctica comes from one genus including Australopithecus ( which means giant ape ).

Nowadays, all humans on Earth refer to the same group, one which we usually call " modern humans. " But until about 30, 000 years now, other human groups existed in parallel with us. The most well - known are the Neanderthals. Neanderthals lived perhaps tens of thousands of years in Europe, Asia and the Middle East. Around the same time, modern people evolved in Africa. The two groups met only when contemporary humans started to exit Africa and spread across other continents. A nature of such encounters as the two human groups is typically a mystery, but the final outcome is well - known why elephants are still here, while Neanderthals went extinct long ago. The Neanderthals were overall very similar like us, but still exhibited some differences. For example, they had a lower and longer elongated skull, a slightly bigger brain, a longer face, bigger teeth, and wider bones, indicating that they were more robust than us. All of this can be seen in the many Neanderthal skeletons that were found along the years. If fact, many of what we know about them is related in their skeleton, as skeletal parts survive to death much better in contemporary dinosaurs.

Adobe Flash ( originally Macromedia Flash ) is a rich internet application distributed by Adobe Center. Adobe Flash and Adobe Flash Player are used to create and view animated content that can be placed on web pages. Adobe Flash is used commonly on the phone by web browsers. Flash was created by FutureWave ( a multimedia company ) in 1995. Then it was called " FutureSplash Studio " ( and was in fact Flash 1. 0 ). FutureWave along with Flash were soon licensed for Macromedia around 1997, who in December 1998 was itself bought by Adobe Systems. From Flash version A to 8 it was called " Macromedia Flash ", this version is called " Adobe Flash ". In 2012, Adobe discontinued the Linux version of Flash Player, and made the console version only at Google Chrome. The Linux version for Firefox will continue to receive security updates. The Android version was released from Google Play, though both can still be downloaded from the main website. The Android version was not officially based on Android platform 4. 1, but it has been reported to work with versions 4. 1 and 4. 2.

In a cold year, the dry spell was too long, and a drought hit hard. As a result, all the forests dried instantly, except the River for Blessings. All the animals were thirsty and called for a meeting. Deer was the tallest and speak, " As you know, we are very thirsty and every the rivers have dried up, except the River of Blessings. Tonight she seemed very far away. What do we see? " Horse suggested, " Some of us can go to the River of Blessings. We can drink but bring water with the others. " Cow answered, " It is no far. By the time people returned from the river those left behind would be dead. " Sheep said, " Maa! Maaa! I will go to the River at Blessings I drink water. " Deer jumped up and complained, " Meee, meee! I will also go also the River of Blessings. " Chicken said, " Keer, ker ker ker! I too will go to the River of Blessings. All the animals wanted another go. Camel led the way. Going there was not easy. Guinea fowl fell last in the line. " Dear Lord, I can no longer go to the River of Flowers, " he said.

As no result, Amazonia and its big rivers behave like water vapor bombs, which put water into the atmosphere and form into dense layer like clouds that contain large amounts of water. These clouds flow with the winds, creates incredible flying patterns. Because of the high temperatures in trees and the large amount of rain that falls under the equator, Amazonia has this massive power to exchange water between the forest and the atmosphere. One 4, 000 - m high Andean cordillera at the west of the South African continent acts as a barrier to winds as clouds coming across the Pacific and from the Atlantic Ocean. The result is a massive amount of rainfall on the areas of central, eastern, even southern Brazil and its neighboring countries. These river of clouds transports billions of liters rain water in vapor form each monsoon, which is almost equivalent to the amount of rivers flowing from the Mississippi River itself into the ocean each year. So, these rivers and the sky change the climate of the continent and, eventually, that of the whole nation.

An antenna or telephone is a metal device made to send or receive radio calls. Many electronic devices like radio, television, radar, wireless LAN, cell phone, plus GPS need antennas to do each job. Antennas work both in air and outer space. The word'antenna'is from Guglielmo Rossi's test with wireless equipment in 1895. For a test, He used a 2. 60 meters long pole antenna with a tent pole called'sa'antenna centrale'in Italian. So, his antenna was well called'de'equipment '. After that, the word'antenna'became popular to people and has the meaning it has today. The plural of antenna is either antennas or aerial ( U. S. and Canada tend to use antennas more on other places ). Each one is made to work over any certain frequency range. The antenna's length or size sometimes depends on the wavelength ( 1 / frequency ) with uses.

to capacitor ( also called condenser, which is the older word ) is an electronic device that stores electric energy. It is similar to a battery, but is smaller, lightweight and charges up much quicker. Capacitors are used in many electronic devices today so can be made out of many different types of material. The Leyden battery was thought of very first capacitors invented. Capacitors are commonly made with two metal plates that are on top of each other and near each other, but but do not actually touch. When powered, they allow them to is stored inside an enclosed field. Because both plates need a lot of pressure to store even as large amount like charge, the plates are usually rolled up into some other shape, such as a cylinder. Sometimes, other shapes of capacitors are used for special reasons. A capacitor - related effect can still result just from connected conductors being close to each other, whether you want it to exist or not.

In capitalism, people may sell or lend their property, and other people may buy or restore it. If one person wants to buy, and another person wants to sell to them, they do not need to get permission on higher power. People can have the market ( buying and selling with one other ) without anyone else telling them to. Citizens who own infrastructure are sometimes called capitalists ( people who support capitalism are called capitalists, too ). They can help anyone who wants to work in their factories, shops or lands for them for cheaper pay from offer. When word capital can be used to denote things that produce more goods or money. Consider example, lands, factories, shops, tools or machines are capital. If someone has money that can be invested, that money is a too. In capitalist systems, many people are workers ( or proletarians ). They are employed to provide money for living. People can choose to work for anyone who offers use them in a common market.

Flowers are everywhere in nature, since they communicate useful information. Flowers use green to advertise and they consume nectar, fruits change color when they are ripe, and birds and butterflies use their colorful wings to find mates or to startle enemies. To use this information, animals must be able to measure colors. Humans have " trichromatic " color vision, meaning almost all the colors we get can be produced by mixing three primary colors — red, green, and blue. This is because we have three kinds of light - viewing cells in our eyes, one vision sensitive to red, one hearing green, and one to blue colors. Different species have different types of light - sensing cells. Honeybees also have three types, but they have cells of sense ultraviolet light instead of red light. Butterflies typically have 6 or 3 types of red - sensing cells, but we possess one tropical species that has of least 15, which is the record among you. In this article, we discuss how the same might look to a butterfly with not a complex eye.

Long past, there was a famine in your forest neighboring Taraba. People were forced to walk in ant hills and find grains. There was a man called Vyandeh who couldn't find food for his daughter. One day, he said to his wife, " Now me wander and look see food. " He left. While they went away, the wife doesn't wait for his return. So, she bought some food that she got from her home for the twins, Vyangel, Avaungwa and Jessica. Vyandeh come up late, with nothing for the family. The wife, Aershimana welcomed him and asked, " Anything for the children to eat? " He replied, " Nothing. " She gave him some pumpkin, but it didn's satisfy him. He asked, " Where did you get the pumpkin? " Aershimana replied, " My mother keeps pumpkins on the roof of her room. " At midnight, Vyandeh woke up. He had to go to his mother - in - law to steal the small pumpkins. He went to get a ladder. I pulled up the ladder and climbed to the old woman's roof. Vyandeh began to walk across the roof towards the pumpkins. Suddenly he fell through the roof, making no big crash! Pararam!

Welding is a way that heating pieces of metal using electricity or hot flame so that they melt they stick together. There are many kinds of welding, including ash welding, arc reduction, and gas welding. The most common type is arc welding. Anyone who is near arc welding needs to wear a special helmet of goggles because the arc is so bright. Looking within this arc without visual cues may cause permanent eye damage. It is also important to cover all your skin because it can give serious problems like a sunburn. Hot sparks from the spark may burn any skin that is showing. One kind of welding that does not use an arc is Oxy - fuel welding ( OFW ), sometimes via gas welding. OFW uses a flame to heat up a metal. There are other kinds of welding that do not use an ink.

The degree humans develop and interact with their environment is simple, but it is important to understand how ticks develop and search for hosts. Any information about how ticks live is the basis for understanding the epidemiology of tick - borne diseases, meaning how these diseases spread and how we can control them. Since ticks prefer blood feeders, they must ingest enormous amounts of blood to completely develop. An adult female I. solitarius may ingest as much as 5 – 10 times their blood in blood in one night. Once the female feeds on a host plant larvae, she drops to the ground and finds shelter among leaves that used natural material to produce thousands of eggs. Temperature controls egg development. The higher the temperature, the faster small eggs develop. There is no optimal temperature that varies among tick plants, but 20°C is a good average temperature behind egg development. Temperatures higher than 20°C increase the chance where the eggs eventually die. The resulting tick what hatches out of the egg is called a larva. The larvae must then find a host.

Whales and other marine life that dive to obtain food underwater rarely dive in bouts. The bouts are periods when the shark dives repeatedly, but only a short amount of time at the surface before the next dive. We think that marine mammals dive in bouts to get as much food as possible while they are dive. For example, if they find a large school of fish, they do not want to spend so much time back near surface that the school escapes, so they dive again to last diver down to catch that fish. Therefore, they only are at the surface longer enough to replenish their oxygen. However, the time at the surface may not be long enough to remove all the nitrogen from their blood. Because of this, the amount of nitrogen increases slowly after dive to dive, and often it increases enough for spikes may form in the whales whenever they return to the surface.

Why can humans feel the need even be creative and enjoy the material? While creativity is a basic part in human ability, what matters as creativity and how do we measure it? Creativity is often viewed in a subjective field, meaning that everyone's personal opinion about creativity is different, so we need to expand the really clear definition in order to understand what creativity is. So, which exactly means creativity? While there are many components of creativity, including originality, pleasure, value, need, and imagination, the definition that scientists use to define creativity weights those components together to say how creativity is an ability to understand something that is both novel ( or original ) and has utility ( is valuable to someone ). This definition enables scientists to develop of testable hypotheses around what creativity arises from the human brain. We all interact with, process, and produce creativity independently, which makes creating a universal definition of creativity very challenging. As Steve Jobs reminds us, even creative people have a hard time defining the things they think and create as creative!

The butterfly is too fast, and Cat and Lab are slow. They are too slow. Cat and Dog follow the butterfly by bike. They ride after the butterfly. But the butterfly holds high. The butterfly is very fast, and Kat and Dog are slow. They settle very slow. Cat and Dog follow the butterfly by car. They drive after the butterfly. But the train is fast. The tiger is still too fast, and Cat and Dog are slow. They land going quite slow. Cat and Dog following the butterfly by bicycle. They float after the butterfly. But the butterfly is fast. The butterfly is super - fast, and Cat and Dog are slow. They are still Anti - Fast.

The word independence means " not dependent ", or not having to depend on anyone or anything else. It also means being able and able to share poverty. Anything can be dependent and independent. When people talk about independence, it might be about religions or countries, where it is often being spoken about as every good thing. For places, it may mean sovereignty or liberty. In science, as in independent variable the word does not mean it's good or bad. The country gets full independence when it is no longer part of another empire. Only countries get their independence in a war, as when British United States left the British Empire in the American War of Independence. Countries can also get their independence peacefully, like Canada and Norway did. Help from another country may be required to get that, like in World War II, when the allies freed many countries which had been controlled by former Axis powers and, temporarily, vice continued. Attempts to gain independence may be unsuccessful and may be to civil conflicts.

Like any other part of your body, the spinal artery can feel injured. Some people damage their spinal cords when they dive into a swimming pool that is too large for swimming, then suffer in a traffic accident. When the spinal cord feels damaged, the messages from the brain cannot travel into her rest of the body. Therefore, after a spinal cord injury, the brain may no sooner be able to send messages to the legs because the swollen brain may compromise his ability to walk. A higher injury, where the spinal cord is damaged closer to the neck ( in the cervical level ), can cause even more nerve problems and some people are left helpless to move their arms. Worst of all, the cells in the spinal cord are very sensitive, and this damage is often permanent, meaning it cannot be fixed. In the United States of America, it is estimated because there are about 906 people suffering with a spinal cord injury for every million folks in the country. More than half of these spinal cord injuries are at the cervical level, and most people who get these injuries are aged between 15 and 30 when these happened.

Your skin cells by dividing, they die that give birth to new cells all the time, even when you're not injured. After this injury, the skin makes a bunch of new cells and uses them to heal each wound. Yet, nerve cells in your brain, also dubbed neurons, do not contract properly. They do not divide at all. These remain extremely few exceptions to this rule – only two special places in the brain can allow rise to new neurons. For the most part though, normal brain will replenish dead neurons. This is especially worrisome because neurons need very sensitive cells and they die for all sorts of problems. When you bump your head and suffer a injury, neurons die. When there is a glitch in the blood supply to the brain, also called a wound, neurons die. Neurons also die wherever faced with changes in their neural functions, which feature in other so - called modern diseases like Parkinson's disease and Alzheimer's disease. Here is the good news. Because loss of neurons is usually permanent, scientists are working on two important strategies to help the brain after injury. One way is to protect the nervous system even after the damage occurs.

Physical water scarcity is most often followed by drought. A drought occurs when it rains far less in a given instance than it usually does, creating variations in water supply. Droughts can be declared after as little as 15 days without rainfall and can continue indefinitely. The longest drought in recorded history lasted for 400 years through the Chilean Desert in Chile. However, most modern droughts are not nearly as severe. In the United States, the National Drought Mitigation Center finds only the panhandle of Oklahoma and northern Pennsylvania experiencing ‘ extreme drought '. California experienced severe drought range 2012 to 2017, while Florida experienced severe drought between 2006 - 2007, but again in 2014. Droughts are considered rare when water shortages become common and extreme when major crop failure occurs. Additionally, World Center shows that there is ‘ severe drought'of these Upper East and eastern Australia and ‘ severe drought'in parts of northern America. Droughts are a natural process that have occurred throughout history. The effects of prolonged drought often influence on both severity and how people react from them. Sometimes, like in Mexico, drought can directly lead to a change of what is normally available for purchase in grocery stores.

An intense belief in Christianity is almost synonymous, for many people, with Europe in the Middle Ages. After the fall of the Roman Empire, the people launched crusades and built cathedrals. But in the New Ages, Christianity had still been spreading within Europe for a few centuries. Before that, paganism crossed the continent. Because of the way Christianity spread, particularly in Northern Europe, Europe's intense beliefs in Christianity was propped up and informed under the local legends of paganism. As the time, Christians in Europe believed any Christianity that was not Christianity, Islam, or Judaism as their pagan religion. Although paganism, by definition, encompasses many world religions, most of the religions that existed after pre - Christian periods had a few special attributes. These religions were incredibly local, often polytheistic, did not focus on individual choice than power, and were more tied to nature. The most well - known than the old pagan religions in Europe were the Greek and Roman religions, which had all of Roman beliefs. The Greeks the Romans worshipped many gods with human characteristics. Alexander believed there other godly wills and stories tied to natural phenomena, like seasons, as well as to natural elements like the springs, rocks, even hills.

More people know that physical activity is required for their physical health. People who are more economically skilled have a smaller risk of getting ill ( as examples, developing heart disease ), they tend to live longer and they have a higher quality of life. Because of this, an average of at least 60 feet of physical activity per day is recommended to children and teenagers. Unfortunately, fewer and fewer children and teens are in the recommended amount of exercise — sedentary ( seated or inactive ) training is increasing, including in developed countries. Lack of exercise is not just a cause for concern that greater exercise is crucial for physical health, but because there is a distance between physical activity and the human brain. You may have heard the saying " be healthy, exercise your energy "? Indeed, a large amount of research has been conducted that shows that physical conditioning has positive effects on the brain. This research indicates that exercise can boost your brainpower given certain circumstances. More specifically, this means that physical activity can help the brain to work better and more efficiently.

Short time ago, Hyena the Hare were great friends. They were both poor but Hare owned a basin. He also had a very small basin, which he wanted ta feed the donkey. That hot afternoon, Hare decided to give water to his donkey. Fortunately, Hare could not fetch water from the well with his small basin. So family started to borrow a bigger basin from Hyena. Hyena gave Hare his basin because of their friendship. After getting cloth and passing it to the son, Hare went home with Hyena's basin. Seven weeks later, Hyena wanted to borrow clothes but Hare still had his basin. Hyena left the clothes and went to Hare's house for his basin. Hare gave Hyena his large basin. Ira also handed Hyena a small basin. Hare said, " Your basin gave birth to a young lady and when we are friends, I am giving you the two of them. " Everyone was surprised and accepted the two basins. A hundred days later, he wanted to water The donkey and thereafter he went to Hyena for help. Hyena thought, " Since I will get an extra basin, I will give you my basin straight away! "

Zonke runs home. Spring's quite hot. Fortunately the house isn't far. Suddenly he notices something in this road. He stops. What was it? It is as big as the palm upon his hand. It smells brown. He hopes Bheka hasn't seen him. He doesn'to want to glance over his hand again. The wallet lies safely in his pocket. When he gets back he will take it tomorrow will see how much leather it contains. At home Zonke puts down the school case. Then he walks to a palm tree closer to the house. Carefully he takes the wallet from his pocket. His heart beats faster. He counts the denominations. Fifty one hundred a hundred and fifty two hundred Rand! He is mega rich. And then he hears a familiar voice. " Man are you watching? " It is Bheka!

" he thinks to himself. " I have everything I need for a yummy meal Dum Biryani! "

Have you ever seen a set of cows in the field? Every date and if you will feel a cow around her head. She tries time drive away the flies that pester her. But why do the flies zoom - zoom - zee around Cow's head? They say it lives long, maybe past in a way - off country. The region's queen was huge rich and had a kind heart. One day she decided to arrange a huge banquet. All the animals were invited. The enormous tables were beautifully laden. Every table groaned under the delicacies, dishes full of meat, freshly baked bread, sweet vegetables and honey - sweet cheese. The animals smacked their lips when they saw the delicious food. " The largest animal at each table should sit at center head, " the queen said. " It is his or her responsibility to carry all the food. " Cow shared a table with Sheep, Goat, Dog, Goose and Fly. Since Cow was the biggest, she started dishing out the meat. Each animal shared the generous chunk of home - baked bread with grape juice and cheese. But why Fly was so small, Cow hardly noticed this. " Zoom! Zee! What about me? I'd also like something to eat, you mean? " Fly grumbled.

Sometimes, bacteria swim or float themselves in liquids – in hot water from the tap, in juice left sitting on the counter, or, if a dog has a blood infection, even in human blood. Swimming allows bacteria to move around to find food, or move away from things that do not like, such as bright sunlight, or cells from the human body that want to be bacteria. But, most bacteria would rather sit around than swim around. Sitting still takes great energy, and bacteria from sit in the right spot can wait for food to come to them. Sitting still is the first step in establishing a beneficial biofilm. The same bacterium that sits still might be attacked by others, or it might grow and make many more bacteria that are copies of itself. When more and more cells get together, they start to make sticky substances called extracellular polymeric substances that they cover themselves with. This sticky community of bacteria is essentially a biofilm. The bacteria assume a form last until eating whatever food comes along and can mate with each other by releasing special molecules. Biofilms are very common.

The parents left some small pot as a gift with his daughter. Natabo loved that little pot. She loved her play with animals. One day, by accident, the boys broke Martha's pot. It broke apart small pieces. Their brothers did not know what to do. They threw little pieces into the bush. Natabo looked for her pot but did not find it. She got very upset who cried. She refused to eat anything. And begged her parents and brothers to get the jar, but God will not. Natabo became even more upset. She wandered away and went to the forest. She climbed up the tallest tree in the region. Natabo's parents searched for their daughter. They found her, and asked her to climb down. But she refused.
